Tutorial - Extending Space Rocks

If you want to see tutorial in a separate web browser window click here.

Importing Project Files

This tutorial is a follow up to GameMaker's tutorial called Space Rocks GML. This tutorial assumes that you have finished this tutorial then takes it a little bit further. This takes us up to the point where we can improve the syntax, add some fancier elements and add escalation. If you have not completed the Space Rocks GML tutorial in full, stop now and complete the above tutorial.

Lets start by importing the assets we created in the Space Rocks tutorial. This is a way you can also import and share common assets amongst game projects. GameMaker Studio 2 makes it simple to move assets between projects. So we will learn how to take all the assets from the Space Rocks GML tutorial and import them into this new project.

Right click on Rooms and select Add Existing this brings up your operating systems file manager. Go to the folder that holds the tutorial you have completed. Look for the rooms folder and import the first room in the list.

Repeat this for the three remaining rooms by right clicking on Rooms and select Add Existing for each of the three rooms.

When you import files it also imports files that are associated with them. So if you open the Objects and Sprites you will see that it added some of them. Also double check that you have imported all 4 rooms from the previous tutorial:

Now look at what game objects you are missing from the original. I am missing obj_bullet. Right Click on Objects> and select Add Existing for obj_bullet.

Add all remaining objects that are missing form the original. In my project I am still missing obj_debris. Add all remaining existing objects that are not in your project yet.

Now open the Sprites folder and look to see what sprites might be missing. It is possible that one, two or three rocks might be missing. Import all three rocks and any other missing sprites:

There is a missing font that we used. Import it now:

The other asset that was added through code is all the audio. Right Click on Sounds> and select Add Existing for all 5 sound files.

Double check that you have all the original resources from the Space Rocks tutorial.

Run the game by pressing the Play Button in the top menu bar to launch the game. It should run exactly the same as it did before. Fix any issues that arise through testing (probably a missing file) and make sure the game runs again as it did originally.

On the next page we will create variables and add comments to the code and review it.
